summary: This document is a response from American Express to a federal grand jury subpoena in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, providing records for Maxwell and related entities. It includes a declaration of records custodian and the subpoena rider listing the specific accounts and records requested by the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subpoena requests all records pertaining to her accounts and related entities from inception to present, indicating she is a central target of the investigation.

persons.name: Toni LaManna
persons.role: Assistant to the Custodian of Records at American Express
persons.context: Signed the Declaration of Custodian of Records certifying the authenticity and business record status of the documents provided in response to the subpoena.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Signed the grand jury subpoena dated December 11, 2019, commanding American Express to produce records.

persons.name: Mark Lubin
persons.context: Listed as the contact for questions regarding the subpoena, indicating his role in the financial investigation.

connections.description: LaManna, as a records custodian for American Express, certified the production of Maxwell's financial records in response to a grand jury subpoena.
Berman, as U.S. Attorney, authorized the grand jury subpoena targeting Maxwell's financial records as part of a criminal investigation.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York issued a grand jury subpoena to American Express for records related to Ghislaine Maxwell and associated entities.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: The subpoena commanded American Express to appear before the grand jury on this date, though a personal appearance was waived if records were produced.

events.title: American Express Subpoena Response
events.description: American Express formally responded to the grand jury subpoena, providing encrypted electronic records and a custodian declaration.

locations: 26 Federal Plaza, New York, NY 10278 (FBI New York Field Office)
40 Foley Square, Room 220, New York, NY (United States Courthouse, Grand Jury location)
43 Butterfield Circle, El Paso, TX 79906 (American Express Subpoena Response Unit)
1500 NW 136th Ave, Sunrise, FL 33323 (American Express business address)
139A Charles St Apt 233, Boston, MA (Address listed for Ghislaine Maxwell)
116A E 65th St, New York, NY (Address listed for Ghislaine Maxwell)
keyFacts: A federal grand jury subpoena was issued to American Express seeking extensive financial records for Ghislaine Maxwell and several associated entities (Terramar Project Inc., Ellmax LLC, Max Foundation, Max Hotel Services Corp).
The subpoena was part of an investigation into alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. ยง 2423(a), which relates to transportation of minors for criminal sexual activity.
The request included a non-disclosure directive, asking American Express not to inform any third party about the subpoena due to the ongoing investigation.
The requested records were comprehensive, covering statements, wire transfers, identification documents, credit card statements, online account IP logs, and all correspondence.
American Express complied by providing encrypted electronic records on January 9, 2020, with a custodian declaration certifying their authenticity as business records.
